image.altText: a crowd of protesters edited in black and white, a sign says girls just want to feel safe

props.synopsis: The federal government has committed to permanent funding to help women escape violence and online measures including an age verification trial to block children accessing pornography. But not everyone is convinced those measures will work.

title.children: Age verification pilot applauded, billion-dollar program panned. What survivors, experts, and advocates think

image.altText: Anthony Albanese gets into the PM's car outside parliament house

props.synopsis: In the lead-up to this year's budget announcement, the Albanese government is struggling to maintain the public's focus and clear air to announce its plans.

title.children: With less than two weeks until the budget is handed down, the government is juggling crises and struggling for clear air

image.altText: Seoul Searching

props.synopsis: South Korea once "sold off" babies to international families. Now adoptees are coming home and looking for answers.

title.children: In Korea, 200,000 babies were 'sold off' to overseas parents. Now some are back for answers

image.altText: troy sivan wears a sparkly, disco ball button-up shirt

props.synopsis: From Dean Lewis to Taylor Swift – here are the big winners at this year's APRA Awards.

title.children: Musicians have voted: Is this the best Australian song of the year?

image.altText: A middle-aged man in a brightly-coloured singlet stands in front of the ocean.

props.synopsis: The anglers from the Northern Territory are lucky to be alive and not "swimming with sharks" after being rescued about 160km west of Darwin.

title.children: Four fishermen rescued after boat sinks in the Timor Sea

image.altText: Photo of a business closed sign

props.synopsis: Australians are being told to brace for a tidal wave of small businesses going bust, and the job losses that may come with that.

title.children: Smaller businesses at significant risk of going to the wall while larger businesses benefit

image.altText: A row of armoured vehicles travels along dry grassland

props.synopsis: Former military and intelligence leaders, including the former chief of Australia's Defence Force, say the government has "astonishingly" forgotten the risk of climate change in its defence strategy.

title.children: Former defence chief says government 'doesn't understand' climate change risk to Australia's security

image.altText: Parramatta children's court

props.synopsis: One of four Sydney teenagers accused of planning a terrorist attack allegedly suggested targeting Jewish community members in a group chat, a court has heard.

title.children: Teen allegedly wanted to target 'a bunch of Jews' in terrorist attack, court hears

image.altText: A young girl speaks at a candlelight vigil, standing behind a microphone.

props.synopsis: Romany's mum Rachel was murdered on Christmas Day three years ago — she has told attendees at one of the many vigils held around Australia for victims of male violence the thought of others going through the same thing is almost too much to bear.

title.children: 'Mum should be here with me': Vigil hears daughter's pain and anger, with Australians turning out to demand change

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaks in a courtyard at Parliament House

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton says foreign interference poses a "significant threat" to Australia in the wake of revelations that Indian intelligence operatives were kicked out of the country in 2020.

title.children: Dutton says foreign interference poses 'significant threat' to Australia amid recent Indian spies revelations

image.altText: Child works on a laptop computer

props.synopsis: The government is pursuing age verification for online porn. It's going to be complicated. Everyone agrees kids shouldn't be able to access porn online. Stopping them is much harder than you might think.

title.children: Three in four Australian children accessed porn before they turned 18. Here's how the government plans to tackle the problem

image.altText: Demonstrators clash at UCLA.

props.synopsis: Student protests over the Israel-Gaza war expand to an increasing number of college campuses in the United States, with Australian students joining the camp-outs demanding that their educational institutions cut ties with Israel.

title.children: Riot police enter Columbia University to end pro-Palestinian encampment as movement takes hold in Australia

image.altText: Traffic backed up on a major road.

props.synopsis: Queensland police are investigating a crash in Brisbane's Legacy Way tunnel that has killed two people and left another in a critical condition.

title.children: Two people dead, one critical after three-vehicle crash in Brisbane tunnel

image.altText: Anthony Albanese with Micaela Cronin.

props.synopsis: At a national cabinet meeting addressing the gendered violence crisis, the federal government commits more than $900 million for a program supporting women leaving violence, and a suite of online measures to combat online misogyny and young people viewing pornography.

title.children: The government has committed $1bn to combat the violence against women crisis. Here's what we know

image.altText: An illustration of a line of silhouetted people walking along a DNA spiral.

props.synopsis: Prenatal testing means some genetic conditions, like Down syndrome, can be identified in utero. But experts say it raises complex and challenging questions about how we value people with disabilities.

title.children: In Iceland, there are almost no babies born with Down syndrome. It's raised concerns from disability advocates

image.altText: A man walks through journalists and cameras.

props.synopsis: Bruce Lehrmann has indicated he may appeal a Federal Court finding that on the balance of probabilities he raped Brittany Higgins.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann set to appeal Federal Court defamation judgment

image.altText: A Qantas jumbo takes off

props.synopsis: Qantas resolves an issue with its app that allowed customers to view the details of other passengers, including names and upcoming flight plans.

title.children: Qantas apologises after app shows passengers' information to other travellers

image.altText: A man wearing green and gold jersey clings to a boulder wall with two hands and a toe

props.synopsis: It's Pay Day! Top-ranked sports climber Campbell Harrison takes a break from training for the Paris Olympic Games to share how working from a young age to pursue his dream career has taught him the value of paying it forward.

title.children: Pay Day with Campbell Harrison: 'I'm always gaslighting myself out of essential purchases to try and save money'

image.altText: A calico cat standing up with its tail raised.

props.synopsis: Galena found herself at the centre of a stressful trip in an Amazon package, a feverish search, a California rescue and a tearful reunion.

title.children: Housecat who enjoys exploring cardboard boxes accidentally posted 860km in Amazon order return

image.altText: A composite photo of two smiling toddlers.

props.synopsis: A child safety officer, who determined two Logan toddlers were at no significant risk of harm in the same month their mother killed them, tells a coroner of pressure to clear cases.

title.children: Child safety officer who determined toddlers were not at risk of harm tells coroner of pressure to 'smash out' reports

image.altText: Two formally-dressed women walk next to each other with a man walking near them.

props.synopsis: Pauline Hanson's legal team tenders a video of her telling Derryn Hinch to leave Australia in her defence against allegations of racial discrimination against senator Mehreen Faruqi.

title.children: Video of Pauline Hanson telling white former senator to 'go back to New Zealand' used in racial discrimination defence

image.altText: china road

props.synopsis: Witnesses told local media they heard a loud noise and saw a hole open up several meters wide behind them.

title.children: Southern China road collapse kills at least 24, injures 30

image.altText: a woman in a hospital bed taking a selfie

props.synopsis: Medical bills examined by experts reveals how Australian chronic pain sufferers are being apparently billed for fictitious services, inflated costs, and treatments for conditions they don't have.

title.children: 'I feel violated, I trusted them': Patients appalled after being shown the true nature of their medical bills

image.altText: Two men sit talking

props.synopsis: Chris Minns pays tribute to his father, the man he has previously said introduced him to the "Labor tribe", following confirmation of his death.

title.children: NSW premier's father dies days after suffering heart attack

image.altText: A selfie-style shot of a dark-eyed man wearing a cap.

props.synopsis: Brett Walker, 37, died in July 2022 after he attacked his partner and then approached police while armed with the knife. A NSW deputy coroner says the actions of the officers involved were "beyond" textbook.

title.children: Coroner praises police involved in fatal encounter with man who stabbed partner in neck

image.altText: A man stands during this year's Anzac Day service in Albany. He's wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: The Liberal Party's Albany branch has endorsed Dr Thomas Brough as its candidate for next year's state election, despite a recent history of controversial public commentary.

title.children: Liberal Party preselects WA councillor who linked queer community to paedophiles

image.altText: A large fish washed up on a South Australian beach.

props.synopsis: A huge creature of the deep estimated to be more than two metres long that washed up on a South Australian beach is "almost certainly" a bump-head sunfish, the state's museum says.

title.children: Huge fish believed to be giant sunfish washes up on SA beach

image.altText: People inspect dead turtles.

props.synopsis: Turtles endemic to WA that have long been under threat now face their biggest challenge yet, as drying wetlands force them to travel into the path of predators and traffic.

title.children: Wildlife authorities probe death of 100 turtles amid drying wetlands

image.altText: drone shot of large collection of caravans gathered around a stage on a big patch of land

props.synopsis: With pop-focused music festivals like Splendour in the Grass and Groove in the Moo calling it quits, family-friendly, smaller festivals in unique locations are thriving.

title.children: What can the Mundi Mundi Bash tell us about the future of music festivals in modern Australia?

image.altText: Nikki Davey wearing a red jumper stands behind potted flowers on a flower farm.

props.synopsis: Nikki Davey shares her approach for scheduling downtime every week, the 1 per cent rule for improvement, and the value in learning something new.

title.children: How the '1 per cent rule' has helped busy flower farmer Nikki Davey

image.altText: A car racing engineer, wearing a headset, stands in a garage looking at monitors.

props.synopsis: Revered Formula 1 car designer Adrian Newey will leave Red Bull Racing, ending a two-decade stint that has netted the energy drink company more than a dozen world championships.

title.children: World champions lose 'a true F1 legend' as Newey announces departure from Red Bull

image.altText: Composite image of Kendrick Lamar and Drake performing live

props.synopsis: The internet weighs in on rap's biggest feud as Kendrick Lamar drops Euphoria — a six-minute take-down of Drake.

title.children: The best reacts to Kendrick Lamar hitting back at Drake in new six-minute diss track

image.altText: Rubbish is strewn across the grass

props.synopsis: A pool lined with green sludge, rotting roofs and termite infested buildings – this derelict island resort has become a sad tourist attraction for all the wrong reasons, and it's not an isolated case.

title.children: Once a mecca for the rich and famous, these island resorts now lie in ruins
